intro: Loeseliastrum franciscanum, commonly known as the Franciscan morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Loeseliastrum franciscanum is adapted to moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight.
